column1: Pain in the eye may be described as a burning, throbbing, aching, or stabbing sensation in or around the eye.
Pain in the eye can be an important symptom of a health problem.
Make sure you tell your doctor if you have eye pain that does not go away.
If the pain is severe, does not go away, or causes vision loss, seek medical attention immediately.
Contact your health care provider if: - The pain is severe (call immediately), or it continues for more than 2 days.
- You have pain, redness, swelling, discharge, or pressure in the eyes.
